title: The Sword of Annihilation
data:
| )   The Sword of Annihilation   *(No tile)* |                                                                                                                           |
| ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                                   | [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")                                                                               |
|                                             |                                                                                                                           |
| Damage vs. small                            | 1d8 **+1d12**                                                                                                             |
| Damage vs. large                            | 1d12 **+1d12**                                                                                                            |
| To-hit bonus                                | **+1d5**                                                                                                                  |
| Bonus versus                                | monsters without [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance")                 |
|                                             |                                                                                                                           |
| Weapon skill                                | [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")                                                                               |
| Size                                        | one-handed                                                                                                                |
| Affiliation                                 | - [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned")
- [forged artifact](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") |
|                                             |                                                                                                                           |
| When carried                                | *(none)*                                                                                                                  |
| When wielded                                | * disintegration resistance                                                                                               |
| When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke")       | *(none)*                                                                                                                  |
|                                             |                                                                                                                           |
| Base price                                  | 25000 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                                       |
| Weight                                      | [37](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                               |
| Material                                    | [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal")                                                                                              |

**The Sword of Annihilation** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It is [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") made of [steel](/wiki/Steel "Steel").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

The Sword of Annihilation can only be created by combining [Angelslayer](/wiki/Angelslayer "Angelslayer") and either [The Eye of Vecna](/wiki/The_Eye_of_Vecna "The Eye of Vecna") or [The Hand of Vecna](/wiki/The_Hand_of_Vecna_\(EvilHack\) "The Hand of Vecna (EvilHack)") at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") - it cannot be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for, and will revert to its base item if left in a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file.

## Description

The Sword of Annihilation has +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and a +1d12 damage bonus against monsters that do not have [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance"), and provides disintegration resistance while wielded. The Sword of Annihilation is also indestructible, much like the [invocation items](/wiki/Invocation_items "Invocation items"), and in particular cannot be disintegrated or permanently lost in a [chasm](/wiki/Air "Air") - it can still potentially be lost if a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") explodes with it inside, however.

Nonresistant monsters hit by The Sword of Annihilation have a 1⁄12 chance of being [disintegrated](/wiki/Disintegrate "Disintegrate") entirely, destroying their inventory along with them and leaving no [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") behind - the exceptions consist of the [Riders](/wiki/Rider "Rider"), who will instead instantly reintegrate with full HP. Otherwise, there is a separate chance of the target's worn armor being disintegrated: the chance is 1⁄3 for worn [shields](/wiki/Shield "Shield"), 1⁄4 for worn [cloaks](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and 1⁄6 for worn [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor").

The Sword of Annihilation can be forged together with [Ashmar](/wiki/Ashmar "Ashmar") to create the [Armor of Retribution](/wiki/Armor_of_Retribution "Armor of Retribution").

## Strategy

The Sword of Annihilation's ability to instantly destroy monsters is especially valuable against [unique monsters](/wiki/Unique_monster "Unique monster") and other hostiles in the late game and endgame that have large pools of [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points"), though this comes at the cost of any valuable loot that they may be carrying.

## Encyclopedia entry

Not much is known about this blade, as very few have lived  
to tell the tale after encountering the one that wields it.  
It is said that everything this sword touches is utterly  
destroyed. Probably more rumor than anything...

The Sword of Annihilation

From NetHackWiki

The Sword of Annihilation is an artifact weapon that appears in EvilHack. It is unaligned, and its base item is a long sword made of steel.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

The Sword of Annihilation can only be created by combining Angelslayer and either The Eye of Vecna or The Hand of Vecna at a forge - it cannot be wished for, and will revert to its base item if left in a bones file.

Description

The Sword of Annihilation has +1d5 to-hit and a +1d12 damage bonus against monsters that do not have disintegration resistance, and provides disintegration resistance while wielded. The Sword of Annihilation is also indestructible, much like the invocation items, and in particular cannot be disintegrated or permanently lost in a chasm - it can still potentially be lost if a bag of holding explodes with it inside, however.

Nonresistant monsters hit by The Sword of Annihilation have a 1⁄12 chance of being disintegrated entirely, destroying their inventory along with them and leaving no corpse behind - the exceptions consist of the Riders, who will instead instantly reintegrate with full HP. Otherwise, there is a separate chance of the target's worn armor being disintegrated: the chance is 1⁄3 for worn shields, 1⁄4 for worn cloaks, and 1⁄6 for worn body armor.

The Sword of Annihilation can be forged together with Ashmar to create the Armor of Retribution.

Strategy

The Sword of Annihilation's ability to instantly destroy monsters is especially valuable against unique monsters and other hostiles in the late game and endgame that have large pools of hit points, though this comes at the cost of any valuable loot that they may be carrying.

Encyclopedia entry

Not much is known about this blade, as very few have lived
to tell the tale after encountering the one that wields it.
It is said that everything this sword touches is utterly
destroyed. Probably more rumor than anything...
